intro: Poa angustifolia subsp. lejeunei, commonly known as narrowleaf bluegrass, is a low-growing perennial grass species native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences bearing numerous tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodlands, and along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and restoration projects.
